full_text: Log in at SuperUser. Go to Underwriting Rules through Business Rules. Select the underwriting rule for BOP, Year Built. Modify the rule so that the user can only approve the issue with the year built no earlier than a limit. Let's review and configure the fields that are related to approving the underwriting issues. On the Rule Details tab, Default Duration specifies the property on the New Approval page, and it indicates when an approval will expire. Keep it as rescinded. Go to the Advanced tab. If Auto Approvable is set to Yes, the issue is automatically approved if the logged in user has the authority to approve it. Default Edit Before Bind corresponds to the property on the New Approval page. Yes indicates the issue will not be raised again if the policy transaction is edited after the issue has been approved. Default Approval Blocking Point. Default Approval Blocking Point specifies the default approval blocking point when an issue is opened for approval. Value Comparator defines how to compare the issue value to see if it is within the authority limit. Select At Least. Value Format Type defines which output format are to use. Keep it as unformatted. Default Value Assignment Type specifies how to compute a default approval value from the value of the issue. Policy Center uses this value if the comparator is set to At Least or At Most. Fixed. Fixed copies the issue value directly to the default approval value. Offset Amount or Offset Percentage adds to the issue value by an offset amount or percentage to produce the default approval value. Select Fixed. Go back to the Rule Details tab. In the Underwriting Issue Details section, the Value field is visible because Value Comparator is set as At Least. It is compared with Authority Grants to determine if the user can approve this issue. After entering the value, click outside of the box to refresh the page. Save the Rule. Click the Gear icon. Log Out. Log In as a Producer. Go back to the same submission that raised the issue for Building Built before 1950. Notice the year is not displayed. Edit Policy Transaction. Click OK to Warning. Click Quote. Go to Risk Analysis. The Year is displayed with the issue, because we configured the Underwriting Rule to record the value. This is the end of demonstration for the Underwriting Rule fields related to approval.

segments.text: Log in at SuperUser. Go to Underwriting Rules through Business Rules. Select the underwriting rule for BOP, Year Built. Modify the rule so that the user can only approve the issue with the year built no earlier than a limit.
Let's review and configure the fields that are related to approving the underwriting issues. On the Rule Details tab, Default Duration specifies the property on the New Approval page,
and it indicates when an approval will expire. Keep it as rescinded. Go to the Advanced tab.

If Auto Approvable is set to Yes, the issue is automatically approved if the logged in user has the authority to approve it. Default Edit Before Bind corresponds to the property on the New Approval page.
Yes indicates the issue will not be raised again if the policy transaction is edited after the issue has been approved.
Default Approval Blocking Point. Default Approval Blocking Point specifies the default approval blocking point when an issue is opened for approval.
Value Comparator defines how to compare the issue value to see if it is within the authority limit.
Select At Least.
Value Format Type defines which output format are to use. Keep it as unformatted.
Default Value Assignment Type specifies how to compute a default approval value from the value of the issue.
Policy Center uses this value if the comparator is set to At Least or At Most.
Fixed.
Fixed copies the issue value directly to the default approval value.
Offset Amount or Offset Percentage adds to the issue value by an offset amount or percentage to produce the default approval value.
Select Fixed.
Go back to the Rule Details tab.
In the Underwriting Issue Details section, the Value field is visible because Value Comparator is set as At Least.
It is compared with Authority Grants to determine if the user can approve this issue.
After entering the value, click outside of the box to refresh the page.
Save the Rule.
Click the Gear icon.
Log Out.
Log In as a Producer.
Go back to the same submission that raised the issue for Building Built before 1950.
Notice the year is not displayed.
Edit Policy Transaction.
Click OK to Warning.
Click Quote.
Go to Risk Analysis.
The Year is displayed with the issue, because we configured the Underwriting Rule to record the value.
This is the end of demonstration for the Underwriting Rule fields related to approval.
